alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 10:55AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Morgan. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Morgan, Brush, Log Lane Village, Hillrose, Snyder, Adena School, Antelope Springs, Gary, Twelve-Mile Corner, Adena, Fort Morgan Airport and Union.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
